translated: Non-dominant

original: Kenaci viññeyyaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kenaci viññeyyo kusalo dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: A wholesome, cognizable by some, dhammas arises conditioned by a wholesome, cognizable by some, dhammas, not as a dominant condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme nava, navipāke nava …pe… navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: As dominant condition, nine … As prior condition, nine … As subsequent condition, nine … As foundation condition, nine … As object condition, nine … As non-causality condition, nine … As non-deprivation condition, nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavāropi paccayavāropi nissayavāropi saṁsaṭṭhavāropi sampayuttavāropi paṭiccavārasadisā vitthāretabbā.)

translated: (The section on origination should be expanded as for the dependent origination.)

original: Hetu

original: Kenaci viññeyyo kusalo dhammo kenaci viññeyyassa kusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: A wholesome object cognizable by one is a condition, as cause condition, for a wholesome object cognizable by one. (Abbreviated.)

translated: As cause, nine; as object, nine; as dominant, nine; as proximity, nine; as contiguity, nine; as repetition, nine; as non-deprivation, nine. (Abbreviated.)

translated: As non-cause, nine; as non-object, nine. (Abbreviated.)
